We’re back again to welcome 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒍𝒚 𝑺𝒎𝒊𝒕𝒉 to Mansfield City Schools! She will be joining us as an Intervention Specialist at Senior High. Read more about Shelly and her enthusiasm for joining our district! 👇

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘭𝘰𝘰𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘢𝘯 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘥𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯. 𝘐 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘢𝘮 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘳𝘪𝘷𝘪𝘭𝘦𝘨𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘊𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘋𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵 𝘸𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘦𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘦𝘥𝘭𝘺.”

Welcome to the Tyger pride, Shelly! We are glad to have you! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

Today, we continue our series to welcome new staff to Mansfield City Schools with 𝑫𝒚𝒍𝒂𝒏 𝑫𝒂𝒗𝒊𝒅. We are happy to have Dylan join our Mansfield Senior High team! 🏫 We invite you to continue reading to learn more about Dylan and how he feels about the Tyger pride of MCS.

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘏𝘰𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥, 𝘖𝘩𝘪𝘰 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 45 𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘶𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘯 𝘌𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘒𝘯𝘰𝘹 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘊𝘭𝘢𝘴𝘴 𝘰𝘧 2016 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘦. 𝘐 𝘢𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘈𝘴𝘩𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘐 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘢 𝘥𝘦𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘺𝘦𝘥𝘧𝘰𝘰𝘵𝘣𝘢𝘭𝘭. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘤𝘶𝘳𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘭𝘺 𝘦𝘯𝘳𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘔𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘳'𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘚𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘌𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘵 𝘒𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘺. 𝘈𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘊𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘑𝘰𝘣 𝘛𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘊𝘰𝘰𝘳𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳 𝘢𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘚𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩. 𝘐 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘫𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳𝘴…

Today, we continue our series to welcome new staff to Mansfield City Schools with 𝑫𝒚𝒍𝒂𝒏 𝑫𝒂𝒗𝒊𝒅. We are happy to have Dylan join our Mansfield Senior High team! 🏫 We invite you to continue reading to learn more about Dylan and how he feels about the Tyger pride of MCS.

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘏𝘰𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥, 𝘖𝘩𝘪𝘰 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘪𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 45 𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘶𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘯 𝘌𝘢𝘴𝘵 𝘒𝘯𝘰𝘹 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘊𝘭𝘢𝘴𝘴 𝘰𝘧 2016 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘦. 𝘐 𝘢𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘈𝘴𝘩𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘐 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘢 𝘥𝘦𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘺𝘦𝘥𝘧𝘰𝘰𝘵𝘣𝘢𝘭𝘭. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘤𝘶𝘳𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘭𝘺 𝘦𝘯𝘳𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘔𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘳'𝘴 𝘰𝘧 𝘚𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘌𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘱𝘳𝘰𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘵 𝘒𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘺. 𝘈𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘊𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘑𝘰𝘣 𝘛𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘊𝘰𝘰𝘳𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳 𝘢𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘚𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩. 𝘐 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘫𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳𝘴…

post_text:
Today, we continue our series to welcome new staff to Mansfield City Schools with 𝑨𝒃𝒃𝒆𝒈𝒂𝒆𝒍 𝑬𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒂𝒌. We are happy to have Abbegael join our Mansfield Senior High team! We invite you to continue reading to learn more about Abbegael and why she’s eager to join MCS.

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘗𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘢𝘨𝘦 𝘓𝘢𝘬𝘦𝘴 (𝘊𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘳𝘺 𝘛𝘰𝘸𝘯𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘱), 𝘖𝘩𝘪𝘰. 𝘐 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘞𝘰𝘰𝘥𝘳𝘪𝘥𝘨𝘦 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘒𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘺. 𝘐 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘨𝘦𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘰𝘳𝘴 𝘨𝘦𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘚𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘤𝘰𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘩- 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘦𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘩-𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘦 𝘨𝘪𝘳𝘭𝘴 𝘷𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘺𝘣𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘔𝘪𝘥𝘥𝘭𝘦 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘢 𝘥𝘪𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘭𝘦 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘮𝘢𝘵𝘩 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦 𝘭𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘴. 𝘐’𝘮 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘢 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘪𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘰𝘵 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴. 𝘖𝘶𝘳 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘱𝘶𝘭𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰𝘨𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘦 𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘸𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘴𝘶𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘴𝘢𝘺𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘨𝘰𝘦𝘴, 𝘸𝘦 𝘵𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺 𝘥𝘰 𝘳𝘰𝘢𝘳 𝘵𝘰𝘨𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳.”

Join us in welcoming Abbegael to the Tyger pride! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar
text:
Today, we continue our series to welcome new staff to Mansfield City Schools with 𝑨𝒃𝒃𝒆𝒈𝒂𝒆𝒍 𝑬𝒔𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒂𝒌. We are happy to have Abbegael join our Mansfield Senior High team! We invite you to continue reading to learn more about Abbegael and why she’s eager to join MCS.

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘗𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘢𝘨𝘦 𝘓𝘢𝘬𝘦𝘴 (𝘊𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘳𝘺 𝘛𝘰𝘸𝘯𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘱), 𝘖𝘩𝘪𝘰. 𝘐 𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘞𝘰𝘰𝘥𝘳𝘪𝘥𝘨𝘦 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘒𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘚𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘜𝘯𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘺. 𝘐 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘨𝘦𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘰𝘳𝘴 𝘨𝘦𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘚𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘤𝘰𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘩- 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘦𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵𝘩-𝘨𝘳𝘢𝘥𝘦 𝘨𝘪𝘳𝘭𝘴 𝘷𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘺𝘣𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘵 𝘔𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘭𝘥 𝘔𝘪𝘥𝘥𝘭𝘦 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘢 𝘥𝘪𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘭𝘦 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮 𝘮𝘢𝘵𝘩 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘥𝘢𝘺 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦 𝘭𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘴. 𝘐’𝘮 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘢 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘪𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘴 𝘢 𝘭𝘰𝘵 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴. 𝘖𝘶𝘳 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘱𝘶𝘭𝘭𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰𝘨𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘦 𝘵𝘪𝘮𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘸𝘦 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘴𝘶𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘴𝘢𝘺𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘨𝘰𝘦𝘴, 𝘸𝘦 𝘵𝘳𝘶𝘭𝘺 𝘥𝘰 𝘳𝘰𝘢𝘳 𝘵𝘰𝘨𝘦𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳.”

Join us in welcoming Abbegael to the Tyger pride! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text: 𝐇𝐚𝐩𝐩𝐲 𝐅𝐢𝐫𝐬𝐭 𝐃𝐚𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐒𝐜𝐡𝐨𝐨𝐥, 𝐓𝐲𝐠𝐞𝐫𝐬! Whether you’re beginning the year at home or in-person, #TygersRoarTogether! We can’t wait to learn together! Have a great day! 🐯 #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families. In anticipation of the first day of class, please see the below updates from the Food Service Department:

◼️ 𝗙𝗼𝗿 𝗜𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻 𝗛𝘆𝗯𝗿𝗶𝗱 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀: At the end of each group’s (Tygers or Falcons) last in-person learning day of the week, take-home meals will be provided by the Food Service Department (usually Tuesdays for Tygers and Fridays for Falcons). Take-home bags will include one breakfast and one lunch for each day of remote learning scheduled during the week (usually three breakfasts and three lunches, schedules may vary). The take-home meal program will continue as long as in-person students are on the 2-3 schedule.

◼️ 𝗙𝗼𝗿 𝗧𝘆𝗴𝗲𝗿 𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗔𝗰𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗺𝘆 (𝗧𝗗𝗔) 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀:…

𝑻𝒉𝒆 𝒃𝒆𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒏𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒐𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒚𝒆𝒂𝒓 𝒊𝒔 𝒇𝒊𝒏𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒚 𝒉𝒆𝒓𝒆! 𝑪𝒂𝒏 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒃𝒆𝒍𝒊𝒆𝒗𝒆 𝒊𝒕? I hope you are enjoying the last few days of your summer break! Whether you are joining us as an in-person/hybrid student or through the Tyger Digital Academy, we are looking forward to a fun, safe and successful school year!

Here are some key reminders:

post_text: 𝗧𝘆𝗴𝗲𝗿𝘀 -- 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘁 𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗲𝗻𝗱 𝗼𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗿 𝗯𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗸! After such an extended time, we are so excited to begin a new school year! Enjoy the weather ☀️ get some rest and we will see all of you on Tuesday, September 8! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Today, we continue our series to welcome new staff to Mansfield City Schools with 𝑱𝒐𝒆𝒚 𝑭𝒖𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔. We are excited to have Joey join our Mansfield Senior High team. Continue reading to learn what excites Joey about working with MCS:

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘉𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘬𝘴𝘷𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘦, 𝘖𝘩𝘪𝘰 - 𝘯𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘊𝘭𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘢. 𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘐 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘣𝘦 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘈𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘎𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘯𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘪𝘯 𝘚𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘮𝘰𝘴𝘵 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘫𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘮 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘩𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘦𝘯𝘦𝘳𝘨𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘤𝘶𝘴 𝘰𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘭 𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘯𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮𝘴𝘦𝘭𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘴. 𝘏𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘰𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘚𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘥𝘦𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘬 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘮𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘶𝘱𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦.”

Join us in welcoming Joey to the Tyger pride! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar
text:
Today, we continue our series to welcome new staff to Mansfield City Schools with 𝑱𝒐𝒆𝒚 𝑭𝒖𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒔. We are excited to have Joey join our Mansfield Senior High team. Continue reading to learn what excites Joey about working with MCS:

“𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘧𝘳𝘰𝘮 𝘉𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘬𝘴𝘷𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘦, 𝘖𝘩𝘪𝘰 - 𝘯𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘊𝘭𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘢. 𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘐 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘣𝘦 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘈𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘯 𝘎𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘯𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘪𝘯 𝘚𝘦𝘯𝘪𝘰𝘳 𝘏𝘪𝘨𝘩. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘮𝘰𝘴𝘵 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘫𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘮 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘩𝘪𝘨𝘩 𝘦𝘯𝘦𝘳𝘨𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘤𝘶𝘴 𝘰𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘭 𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘯𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘰𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘮𝘴𝘦𝘭𝘷𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘴. 𝘏𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘰𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘚𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘥𝘦𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘢𝘭𝘬 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘫𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘴 𝘮𝘦 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘶𝘱𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦.”

Join us in welcoming Joey to the Tyger pride! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐡𝐞𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐡 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫! -- If your student has allergies, a chronic medical condition or other healthcare needs that requires special attention, please ensure the proper form is on file to assist us with managing their condition. A signed form from a healthcare provider must be provided to the school nurse. Contact information for school nurses by building are listed below. #HearUsRoar

We are so excited to begin a series on our new staff at Mansfield City Schools! With all the changes and transitions, we are grateful to have new educators and staff members joining us!🏫

Our first new staff member is no stranger to our district. 𝑨𝒍𝒆𝒙𝒊𝒔 𝑩𝒓𝒊𝒈𝒈𝒔 is a Class of 2013 alumni of MSH. Read why she is so excited to work with us:

“𝘐’𝘮 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘢𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘢𝘯 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘢𝘤𝘵 𝘰𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘥𝘪𝘥 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘮𝘦 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘴 𝘢𝘨𝘰. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘢 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘧𝘢𝘮𝘪𝘭𝘺 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘱𝘦𝘥 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦 𝘮𝘦 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘰𝘯 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘵𝘰𝘥𝘢𝘺.”

Join me in welcoming Alexis to the Tyger pride! 🐯 #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
It’s Orientation Week! Today, August 31, is Teacher Work Day. Our educators are completing preparations in their classrooms - digitally and in-person! 🧑‍🏫Tomorrow, September 1, begins orientation for all our students, whether Tyger Digital Academy or in-person. Our students will get acquainted with health protocols, online portals and navigating classrooms and buildings!

🐯 Tygers -- we are excited to have you back! Be sure to capture and share all the back-to-school fun on social media by tagging #TygersRoarTogether. Remember to make your post public so we can see and share the excitement! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families!

This is orientation week for all students! Tomorrow, August 31, we will begin with a Teacher Work Day, dedicated to our educators to ensure they have the time to prepare classrooms and connect with families as we all begin a vast transition to an uncommon school year.

Last week, our staff and administrators began connecting with each other and preparing for the arrival of our students. They have been engaged in professional development, building lesson plans, assembling PPE materials and hanging signage. Many buildings hosted drive-thru meet and greets and school supply drop offs. Some families met their staff and teachers for the first time while others were…

post_text:
𝑻𝒚𝒈𝒆𝒓 𝑫𝒊𝒈𝒊𝒕𝒂𝒍 𝑨𝒄𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒎𝒚 (TDA), 𝒈𝒓𝒂𝒅𝒆𝒔 𝑲-6, 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒆𝒅𝒖𝒍𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒍𝒍 𝒇𝒐𝒍𝒍𝒐𝒘 𝒕𝒉is 𝒄𝒂𝒍𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒂𝒓 👉 https://tinyurl.com/yx9slpbz. TDA students will 𝒏𝒐𝒕 attend in-person. On orientation day, a link will be posted by grade level on the website. Follow this path to see the link on the appropriate day: Home > Schools > Tyger Digital Academy. Teachers will be in contact with families to answer questions, share schedules and information that is grade level specific. Classes begin Tuesday, September 8.

If you are new to the district 𝒂𝒏𝒅 enrolled in TDA but have not filled out the appropriate paperwork for your student, visit your student’s homeschool or the Raemelton Administration Building from 7:30 a.m. to 4 p.m., Monday through Friday. #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar
text:

post_text:
📢 This announcement is for Springmill STEM families! Tomorrow, August 26 from 4:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m., join the staff for a drive-up meet and greet and to drop off your child’s school supplies. 𝙋𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙨𝙚 𝙗𝙚 𝙨𝙪𝙧𝙚 𝙖𝙡𝙡 𝙨𝙪𝙥𝙥𝙡𝙞𝙚𝙨 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙡𝙖𝙗𝙚𝙡𝙚𝙙 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙’𝙨 𝙣𝙖𝙢𝙚.

👉 Drive down Trimble Road, turn left onto Pat Lane and turn left onto Everett Lane. Without leaving your car, drop off your child’s supplies. Then proceed down Everett Lane along the school. Teachers will be lined up to introduce themselves and greet everyone. Exit the school area down Nestor Drive back to Trimble.

We are excited about the new school year! #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
𝙏𝙮𝙜𝙚𝙧 𝘿𝙞𝙜𝙞𝙩𝙖𝙡 𝘼𝙘𝙖𝙙𝙚𝙢𝙮 𝙤𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙜𝙧𝙖𝙙𝙚𝙨 7-12 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙨 𝙖 𝙬𝙚𝙚𝙠 𝙛𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙩𝙤𝙙𝙖𝙮! Visit Mansfield Senior High from September 1-3 on your assigned date.

↪️ September 1 - Grades seven and nine
↪️ September 2 - Grades eight and 10
↪️ September 3 - Grades 11 and 12

Choose two times: 3:30 p.m. - 5:00 p.m. or 5:15 p.m. - 6:30 p.m.. Multiple stations will be provided for students to receive their schedules, complete a code of conduct signature page and an emergency medical form, receive a student photo I.D., and a Chromebook. One adult may accompany each student. Social distancing protocols and masks are required.

Families may visit the high school through August 28 during normal school hours to pick up their registration packet to return during orientation. See you there! #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families!

Tomorrow, our teachers and staff will officially come back to their school buildings after a long five months since the COVID-19 pandemic closed our doors. There will be much work to do this week! Teachers, staff and administrators will be coming together, preparing classrooms, organizing, installing equipment, testing Tyger Digital Academy platforms, engaging in training and working together to determine the best ways to support and enhance learning. I am so grateful to work with people who believe in our district and our students. The work continues to ensure the highest quality of education and safety for all as we count down to the week of August 31.

We had…

Please have your student’s social security number in order to qualify through Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF). Students enrolled in Tyger Digital Academy are welcome! Please have your student’s social security number in order to qualify through Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF). Students enrolled in Tyger Digital Academy are welcome! One adult may accompany each student. We ask all individuals entering the building wear a face mask and follow social distancing protocols. post_text: One of the many changes resulting from COVID-19 was the process for taking Advanced Placement (AP) exams. In spring 2020, for the first time ever, the tests were administered online. We are so proud of our students for all their hard work, commitment to learning, and perseverance through changes. Join us in congratulating our students who earned a score of 3 or higher! Congratulations Tygers! 🐯 #HearUsRoar

shared_text:
Mansfield City School District
August 17 at 10:00 AM ·

Today, August 17, begins 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦 𝐩𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐮𝐩 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐬𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐡 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐞𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐡 𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞𝐬! Families can stop by Mansfield Senior High at 124 N. Linden Road from 12:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. Arrive early to fill out your paperwork and expedite your wait time!

Your student's social security number is required to qualify through Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF). One adult may accompany each student. We ask all individuals entering the building wear a face mask and follow social distancing protocols. 𝐈𝐟 𝐲𝐨𝐮 𝐚𝐫𝐞 𝐬𝐭𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐢𝐧 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐨𝐟 𝐚𝐧 𝐨𝐥𝐝 𝐂𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐛𝐨𝐨𝐤, 𝐩𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐧 𝐢𝐭 𝐨𝐧 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐬𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐥𝐞𝐝 𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦 𝐩𝐢𝐜𝐤 𝐮𝐩 𝐝𝐚𝐲. See you there! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening, Tyger families!

Can you believe we are officially two weeks away from the start of the 2020-2021 school year? So many changes and unexpected turns have occurred since the closing of our school buildings due to COVID-19 on March 16. There has been much anticipation about the beginning of this school year and the time is finally here! School orientation begins with a staggered start the week of August 31.

This week, administrators will be meeting to determine which group -- Tygers or Falcons -- your student will be a part of. Families will receive this update no later than Monday, August 24.

𝑺𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒇𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒆𝒔 𝒐𝒇 𝑾𝒐𝒐𝒅𝒍𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝑬𝒍𝒆𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒂𝒓𝒚 are invited to join staff and teachers on 𝐓𝐡𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐝𝐚𝐲, 𝐀𝐮𝐠𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟐𝟕 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝟒:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. 𝐭𝐨 𝟔:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. for a drive-thru meet and greet! 🚗 Drive through the bus lane to meet the staff! In addition to the meet and greet, this is an opportunity for families to do the following:

👉 Drop off school supplies labeled with your student’s name. Teachers will prepare the supplies for orientation day.
👉 Sign forms to receive your student’s Chromebook.

We are so excited to see you! #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
𝗔𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗳𝗮𝗺𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗱𝗲𝘀 𝟳-𝟭𝟮! 𝗨𝗻𝗶𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺 𝗽𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝘂𝗽 𝗯𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗻𝘀 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟭𝟳! Pick up times each day are from 12:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. See below for the schedule:

Monday and Tuesday, August 17-18 - seventh and eighth grades
Wednesday, August 19 - ninth grade
Thursday, August 20 - 10th grade
Friday, August 21 - 11th and 12th grades

Each student will receive two shirts and two pairs of pants. Arrive early to fill out paperwork. Your student's social security number is required in order to qualify through TANF. One adult may accompany each student. We ask all individuals entering the building to wear a face mask and follow social distancing protocols.

If you are still in possession of an old Chromebook, please return it on your scheduled uniform pick up day. #TygersRoarTogether #HearUsRoar

post_text:
“This is my home. I wanted to teach at Mansfield Senior High School, as I was a graduate from this very school,” Danny Logan, Senior High History Teacher and Alum.

Mr. Logan shares his love of history by not only teaching U.S. history but also the history of our city! Growing up in Mansfield and attending Mansfield City Schools gives him a unique perspective to connect his content to a student’s individual experience. Thank you Mr. Logan! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Did you know there are 𝐫𝐞𝐪𝐮𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐝 𝐢𝐦𝐦𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐳𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 for students entering kindergarten, seventh and twelfth grades? Take a look at your student’s records to see what immunizations they may need!

➡️ Kindergarten: Booster doses of Dtap, Polio, MMR, Chickenpox, completed series of Hepatitis B vaccine

➡️ Seventh Grade: Tdap and Meningococcal vaccine

➡️ Twelfth Grade: Meningococcal vaccine

📱Call Richland County Public Health at 419-774-4700 or Third Street Family Health Services at 419-522-6191 to schedule an appointment 📅 today! For a complete list, click here https://tinyurl.com/yx8tbvdk. #FactFriday #HearUsRoar

post_text: We're less than 30 minutes away from our special Board of Education meeting! Join us at 5:30 p.m. #HearUsRoar

Mansfield City School District
August 3 at 10:00 PM ·

Is your student up to date on their immunizations? Students starting kindergarten, and those entering seventh and twelfth grades have required and recommended shots.

Beginning today, August 3, Richland County Public Health is taking appointments for immunizations! Call 419-774-4700 to schedule an appointment. Spots are filled Monday through Thursday, on a first come, first served basis. For more information, including what documents to bring, insurance options, mask requirements, visit the website https://tinyurl.com/yx8tbvdk. #HearUsRoar

post_text:
When our alumni return to MCS to teach, we couldn’t be more proud! Charles Sackman, Class of 1997 and current Career Tech Education (CTE) teacher did just that!

“The skills I learned at Mansfield Senior High's automotive program 𝙚𝙢𝙥𝙤𝙬𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙙 𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙗𝙚 𝙨𝙚𝙡𝙛- 𝙨𝙪𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙞𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙞𝙢𝙢𝙚𝙙𝙞𝙖𝙩𝙚𝙡𝙮. It was a wonderful feeling to graduate and make almost three times the minimum hourly wage.” he said. Mansfield Senior High’s CTE program prepares students with a trade upon graduation.

“I came back to teach after a successful 20 years of field experience. I love that I have the chance to show these students how the mechanical world works and think that I get more satisfaction out of their successes than they do!” 🔧🧰 #HearUsRoar

post_text:
“I grew up in the country and went to a school not too far away in distance but light years away in open mindedness,” says Nate Hess, teacher at Mansfield Senior High. “I go to work every day to 𝙩𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙨𝙝𝙖𝙥𝙚 𝙢𝙮 𝙨𝙩𝙪𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 into successful Tygers and am fortunate enough to learn from them and grow with them.”

“𝙄 𝙙𝙞𝙙 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙨𝙩𝙖𝙧𝙩 𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙖 𝙏𝙮𝙜𝙚𝙧, 𝙗𝙪𝙩 𝙄 𝙬𝙞𝙡𝙡 𝙛𝙞𝙣𝙞𝙨𝙝 𝙖𝙨 𝙤𝙣𝙚. I want to grow with this district, send my kids through this district and a long time from now retire from this district. Thank you, Mansfield City Schools, for letting me call you home.”

Once a Tyger, always a Tyger, Mr. Hess! We are glad to have you! #HearUsRoar

¿Sabias? (Did you know?) 𝑺𝒑𝒂𝒏𝒊𝒔𝒉 𝑰𝒎𝒎𝒆𝒓𝒔𝒊𝒐𝒏 is recognized as a National Blue Ribbon School by the U.S. Department of Education. An estimated 41 million people in the U.S. speak Spanish. That’s 13.5% of the entire population!

In conjunction with Richland County Public Health, the superintendents in Richland county are working together to align public health standards with the reopening of our school districts in the fall. Mansfield City Schools will use this framework as guidance for how we operate the 2020-2021 school year. Read more about the county’s plan here ➡️ https://www.mansfieldschools.org/CoronavirusClosure.aspx

We appreciate your patience as we finalize our plans for in-person classes for this fall. Details will be announced soon! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
There are so many reasons to 🧡 Mansfield City Schools. Matt Keasel, Director of Choirs, managed to narrow it down to five - read his reasons why!

🧡 The staff and administration care about the students and EACH OTHER more than anywhere else I have worked.
🧡 Mansfield Senior is focused on students succeeding in all possible areas of their lives. We're not just preparing them for college track, we're giving them an entire worldview to select from, and giving them the tools to make sure they are prepared when they achieve graduation.
🧡 I am raising my family in this community, so it is doubly rewarding to play a part in its development.
🧡 I am trusted to be creative and innovative in my teaching, and am confident I can try new things with students.

#HearUsRoar

post_text: This fall, Mr. Kentosh will celebrate his 41st year teaching in the classroom -- 27 of those years have been spent with Mansfield Senior High. Of all the places he’s taught, “I have enjoyed Mansfield Senior High School the most,” he said. The diversity of the school, working with dedicated educators and the impact of the Career Tech program on his son’s career, are reasons 𝕄𝕒𝕟𝕤𝕗𝕚𝕖𝕝𝕕 ℂ𝕚𝕥𝕪 𝕊𝕔𝕙𝕠𝕠𝕝𝕤 stands out for him. Thank you Mr. Kentosh! We are glad to have you! 🧡 🦁 #HearUsRoar

All paths lead to your success! We’re excited to bring Mansfield Senior High students multiple learning options for the 2020-2021 school year! Whichever option you choose, all students will receive:

✔️ Chromebook 💻
✔️ Home access to Wi-Fi - if needed

For more information and to register, go to https://tinyurl.com/ycw524re.

Additional questions? Contact Mansfield Senior High Principal, Marinise Harris at (419) 525-6369.

“𝕀 𝕙𝕒𝕧𝕖 𝕗𝕦𝕟 𝕒𝕥 𝕨𝕠𝕣𝕜 𝕖𝕧𝕖𝕣𝕪 𝕤𝕚𝕟𝕘𝕝𝕖 𝕕𝕒𝕪!” ☺️

Those are words from Katy Endsley, Social Studies teacher at Senior High. Our teachers keep us going! Showcasing #TygerPride every day is what we strive for! “I love being a teacher at Mansfield Senior High. My favorite day of the year is touring through the Career Tech programs with the Sophomore Academy. Our teaching staff is great at what they do and we work so well together. We really teach the whole student.” Thank you, Ms. Endsley! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Today Thursday, July 2, Governor DeWine announced back to school health and safety guidelines for all school districts across Ohio. Mansfield City Schools is currently reviewing those guidelines.

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

We will be reviewing the latest information from the governor so we can meet the requirements set forth in these guidelines. Once we know more, we will share more details. #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening Tyger families! First, I have an important message regarding our second session of summer school. Registration for the second session of summer school will begin on Sunday, June 28 and conclude on Sunday, July 5 at 12:00 p.m. The second session of summer school will begin on July 6 and end on July 24.

This week we will move into the heart of the summer season as we celebrate the Fourth of July on Saturday. It will be a time of family gatherings and fireworks as we mark the birth of our nation. Unfortunately, it will be a weekend still clouded by the realities of COVID-19. Although news reports can be confusing it is obvious that the coronavirus will continue to impact us for…

post_text: 🎨🖼️ Did you know? Visual art students from Mansfield City Schools have a wide range of opportunities to showcase their skills and talents, such as the Ohio Governor’s Youth Art Exhibition which draws 11,500 submissions annually from all over Ohio. Some students have their art in permanent collections throughout Mansfield. Their work can be found at local venues such as Third Street Clinic and Akron Children’s Hospital. #HearUsRoar #FactFriday

We believe a child centered curriculum is the core of early childhood education. Our pre-kindergarten curriculum consists of both content and process designed to meet the needs of the whole child - cognitive, social, emotional, and physical by being integrated, flexible and comprehensive.
🏫📖

It’s not too late to register your future Tyger! 🐯 Registration can be completed from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., Monday through Friday at the Raemelton Administration Building, 856 W. Cook Road. #FactFriday #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger Families! 🐯 This school year is officially over! Once again, I want to thank our families and our entire school community for working with us to conclude the interrupted year successfully!

Now, our priority turns to how our schools might open in August. Last week, Governor DeWine said he wants to see students back in their classrooms. Our district leadership is working on three broad based outlines for August:

1. All students returning, in-person
2. Blended learning - students participate both in-person and remotely
3. All remote learning - virtual for all students, pre-K through 12th grade

We will continue to prepare our options for the upcoming school year. When we have…

It’s officially the last day of the 2019-2020 school year! 𝕎𝔼 𝕄𝔸𝔻𝔼 𝕀𝕋! Although the school year was seemingly overshadowed by the closing of school buildings due to the pandemic of COVID-19, there were still so many memories made. Here are a some highlights:

🧡 Robotics Club of MSH having their best ever performance at the VEX Robotics Tournament
🧡 Dr. Austin McCoy, MSH Alumni, presented the keynote address for the MLK, Jr. community breakfast
🧡 Nine students from MCS were honored for having a perfect score on the math portion of the state test 💯
🧡 Coffee on the Curb at Spanish Immersion ☕
🧡 MSH football team makes a trek to the Division III state football championship game 🏈
🧡 Women from…

𝐆𝐎𝐎𝐃 𝐄𝐕𝐄𝐍𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐓𝐘𝐆𝐄𝐑 𝐅𝐀𝐌𝐈𝐋𝐈𝐄𝐒! Our school year comes to an end this week! Although we have not been in school buildings since March 16, the last official day of the school year is tomorrow, June 1. I want to thank all the Tyger parents, guardians, grandparents and others for your support during these past nine weeks. Many of you did double duty as co-teachers at home. I commend all students who completed their assigned lessons.

Throughout the summer, please look for opportunities to keep students engaged in learning. Suggestions for activities were included in the last at-home packet distributed on May 20 and May 21. Families, encourage your young tygers to read, read and read! 📙📙📙

Because of…

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger families! Our Mansfield Senior High Class of 2020 modified in-person graduation was a ＨＵＧＥ ＳＵＣＣＥＳＳ ! 🎉🎉🎈🎈 I want to thank everyone who played a role in its creation! The video was broadcasted live on the district’s website as well as on WFMD TV. When it was decided that we couldn’t have our traditional ceremony in Pete Henry gymnasium due to COVID-19 and social distancing requirements, there was concern about how we could recognize our graduates.

The video plan, developed by Principal Marinise Harris and Assistant Principal Robert McQuate and their team, enabled Brian Skowronski to create an innovative way for graduates to walk the stage in front of friends and/or family.…

📢Today’s the day! The recording of the modified in-person graduation ceremony will be streamed 🅣🅞🅝🅘🅖🅗🅣 May 23, 2020 at 7:00 p.m! You can watch by logging on to the district’s website ➡️ www.tygerpride.com.

🅒🅞🅝🅖🅡🅐🅣🅤🅛🅐🅣🅘🅞🅝🅢 to the Class of 2020! We wish you all the best in your future plans! It has been a pleasure and an honor to help guide you through your journey so far. We are proud of your hard work, dedication and commitment. #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Please join us live on Facebook for our Board of Education Meeting! Tune in to this page as we go 🅛🅘🅥🅔 at 5:30 p.m. Agenda items include:

✅The appointment of Shirley Jefferson as assistant principal at Malabar Intermediate, effective August 1.
✅First reading of the job description for a full-time COVID-19 preparedness and response coordinator.
✅Approval of a list of 153 students for the graduating class of 2020. 🎓

We hope you can join us! #HearUsRoar

𝑮𝒐𝒐𝒅 𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒏𝒊𝒏𝒈, 𝑻𝒚𝒈𝒆𝒓 𝒇𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒍𝒊𝒆𝒔! There are less than 2 weeks remaining in this school year, and I am asking you tonight to join us in closing out the year on a positive note. We have designated 2 dates this week, Wednesday, May 20 and Thursday, May 21 for a 𝐅𝐈𝐍𝐀𝐋 push to collect completed assignments sent home in 3 separate lesson packets since March. Staff will be at all schools from 𝟏𝟎:𝟎𝟎 𝐚.𝐦. 𝐭𝐨 𝟏:𝟎𝟎 𝐩.𝐦. both days to accept completed work from packets 1, 2 and 3.

Returning these assignments is extremely important for 2 reasons:
✅ This work counts the same as classroom instruction.
✅ Completed work allows our teachers to assess student progress and respond accordingly.
A letter explaining…

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger families! Happy Mother’s Day to all Tyger mothers! The love and respect we have for our mothers is a constant anchor whether in times of prosperity or turmoil.

Amidst the current turmoil caused by COVID-19, we remain hopeful to end the 2019-2020 school year successfully. Students in pre-k through eighth grade are working on their third at-home study packet. Mansfield Senior High students are completing lessons online. Well over 300 Chromebooks have been distributed to ensure students have access to complete their assignments.

This past week, we began recording high school graduates of the Class of 2020 for the modified in-person ceremony. This will continue through the…

post_text: In honor of Teacher Appreciation Week, we’re sharing this #TBT which demonstrates how teachers can be much more than just a person teaching a subject in a school. They can also be a person to talk to and lean on when we need them! 🧑‍🏫#2004 #HearUsRoar #ThankATeacher

Good Evening Tyger Families! Two months ago, no one could have envisioned the impact COVID-19 would have on our immediate communities. The closing of our school buildings on March 16 has altered our school year in many ways. Our inability to hold a traditional in-person commencement ceremony is a tremendous loss to the Mansfield Senior High School Class of 2020, their families, district staff and the community at large.

As you may have read on the website, the Senior High staff has created a modified in-person ceremony while complying with all social distancing guidelines set by health officials and the Governor. While it doesn’t replace the ceremony we desire, it is our very best effort to…

Lesson packets for children in pre-kindergarten through third grade may be picked up at the students’ schools Monday, April 27 - Wednesday, April 29, from 9:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Good Evening Tyger Families! Tomorrow, April 27, we begin distribution of our third round of at-home lessons for students in pre-K through eighth grade. These packets will serve as instructional lessons for students through Friday, May 15. In addition, we will be distributing Chromebooks for Mansfield Senior High students, grades 9-12, to use for online instructional work that will be assigned. If you have any questions or concerns about picking up your students’ packet, you may contact their school. For the complete packet and Chromebook pick up schedule visit, https://tinyurl.com/yddxzpf9.

Please also be sure to turn in previously completed packets at this time if you have not done so…

post_text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. We are in this together. #HearUsRoar #InThisTogetherOhio

post_text:
Good Evening Tyger Families! Tomorrow, April 20, we return to at-home lessons! We hope your break was relaxing and enjoyable! We continue to be committed to the education of our students through distance learning.

Although news reports can be confusing, there is some consensus that COVID-19 is leveling off. Though reports are encouraging, this does not mean a return to normalcy anytime soon. While we sort through daily changing reports, we must continue the task at hand to provide the best education possible through the at-home lessons prepared and sent home by teachers and staff.

This week, teachers will prepare a third set of at-home study packets. Soon, we will share pickup dates and time. Please understand that these lessons are not homework, but school work, to take the place of students being in their classrooms. It is vitally important that this work is completed and returned. Let’s all work together, support each other and get the job done! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
Good evening Tygers! Spring break begins tomorrow, Monday April 13, and runs through Friday April 17. We will still distribute sack lunches and the next day’s breakfast from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. Monday through Friday at our three sites: Malabar Intermediate, Mansfield Senior High and Springmill STEM Elementary. Hundreds of meals are provided daily by our dedicated staff and committed volunteers to ensure that those who rely on school meals still have access to them.

While this COVID-19 time is unprecedented for us, let’s remember our ancestors who survived the Spanish Flu of 1918 that infected an estimated ⅓ of the world’s population as well as our oldest living generation who fought through World War II. Today, with the help of modern medicine, our nation once again resolves to ban together to overcome the novel coronavirus.

“We don’t develop courage by being happy everyday. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.” - Barbara De Angelis, New York Times bestselling author.

Be safe, strong and courageous Tyger Family! #HearUsRoar

post_text: Good Morning Tygers! As we move into another week of virtual learning, please know your concerns and questions are being considered. While we understand the importance of spring events like Senior Prom, Class Day and commencement, we are carefully considering health and safety precautions. While we weigh the outcomes of these events, we continue to focus on maximum academic achievement. Our staff and administration are meeting regularly and are doing all we can to make this last quarter of the school year impactful. Thank you for your continued support! #HearUsRoar

Our staff and administration are meeting regularly and are doing all we can to make this last quarter of the school year impactful. Thank you for your continued support! #HearUsRoar

post_text:
***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We want to take this opportunity to thank our entire staff for their hard work, and all of our families for their ongoing support. We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #HearUsRoar
text:
***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We want to take this opportunity to thank our entire staff for their hard work, and all of our families for their ongoing support. We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #HearUsRoar

post_text:
UPDATE: 6:25 p.m. - Please visit https://tinyurl.com/rogrmax for additional information regarding this announcement.

Earlier today, March 12, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine announced all schools will be closed beginning at the end of the school day Monday, March 16, 2020 through Friday, April 3, 2020 due to COVID-19. We will share more information in regard to the impacts of this direction as soon as it is available. Thank you for your patience during this unpredictable time. #HearUsRoar
